thread.title: Clive Lewis could 'walk' from shadow cabinet over Brexit vote
thread.title_full: Clive Lewis could 'walk' from shadow cabinet over Brexit vote | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Clive Lewis could 'walk' from shadow cabinet over Brexit vote
text:
Clive Lewis is prepared to leave the shadow cabinet if amendments to the Article 50 Bill are not accepted. Credit: ITV News Anglia Shadow Business Secretary Clive Lewis has told ITV News Anglia he will "walk" from the shadow cabinet if the Article 50 Bill being debated in Parliament is not amended to avoid a "Hard Brexit".
The Norwich South MP said he will support the Bill at the second reading in Parliament tomorrow, but will not be able to vote for it at next week's third reading if Labour's amendments are not accepted.
Jeremy Corbyn has issued a 3 line whip requiring Labour MPs to back the Bill.
Norwich was one of few areas in the East of England where the majority of voters backed remaining in the European Union in last year's referendum.
Clive Lewis has been tipped as a potential future Labour leader. Credit: PA Norwich MP joint favourite for the Labour leadership Last updated Tue 31 Jan 2017 Politics Norfolk Norwich
